Public Attributes

std::vector
< FormalParameterDefinition * > * 		formalParameters
 List of function parameters. FormalParameters are type of FormalParameterDEFINITION, because in C++, could be written "void foo(int a = 0);" to set default value.
FunctionMemberAttributes * functionMemberAttributes
 Specifies if member function is virtual, friend, const or inline.

Detailed Description

Function declarations.

C++

  • example: 
    int foo(int bar1, char);    // this->functionMemberAttributes = NULL (because function is not member of any class),
                            // this->formalParameters = { "int bar1", "char" } (C++ function delaration must specify parameters types, not names)

See also:
Declaration

Member Data Documentation

std::vector<FormalParameterDefinition *>* FunctionDeclaration::formalParameters

List of function parameters. FormalParameters are type of FormalParameterDEFINITION, because in C++, could be written "void foo(int a = 0);" to set default value.

See also:
FormalParameterDefinition

FunctionMemberAttributes* FunctionDeclaration::functionMemberAttributes

Specifies if member function is virtual, friend, const or inline.

See also:
FunctionMemberAttributes
